questions.description: Repair mechanical or electrical items with tools.
Use hand or power tools to build something.
Operate machinery or equipment safely.
Work outdoors doing physical tasks.
Install or maintain systems (plumbing, electrical, etc.).
Drive or operate vehicles as part of the job.
Assemble furniture or structures.
Inspect and fix mechanical issues.
Analyze data to find patterns.
Design experiments to test ideas.
Solve complex math or logic problems.
Research why something failed and propose fixes.
Read scientific articles and apply findings.
Develop software or scripts to solve problems.
Model scenarios using statistics.
Formulate hypotheses and verify them.
Create art, illustrations, or visuals.
Write stories, articles, or creative content.
Compose music or work in audio production.
Design logos, posters, or visual identities.
Perform acting, dance, or other stage arts.
Take and edit photos or video.
Conceptualize and prototype creative ideas.
Craft objects by hand (ceramics, jewelry, etc.).
Teach or tutor and explain concepts.
Care for people who need support.
Lead group discussions or workshops.
Provide counseling or guidance to others.
Mediate conflicts and help people reach agreement.
Coordinate volunteers or community events.
Mentor individuals in their development.
Facilitate training sessions.
Sell products or ideas and persuade others.
Lead teams to achieve business goals.
Negotiate deals or contracts.
Start or grow a business or venture.
Pitch solutions to decision makers.
Plan marketing or go-to-market strategies.
Manage budgets and profitability.
Network to open opportunities.
Organize records, documents, or data accurately.
Work with numbers, finances, or budgets.
Follow clear procedures and standards.
Schedule tasks and plan workflows.
Keep databases or spreadsheets tidy.
Prepare formal reports and documentation.
Ensure compliance with rules and policies.
Improve and standardize processes.

carreras.description: Technical trades, maintenance, engineering tech, logistics, field operations.
Science, research, data analysis, laboratory roles, R&D, analytics.
Design, visual arts, multimedia, writing, advertising, creative direction.
Education, health support, counseling, HR development, community services.
Business development, sales, marketing, management, entrepreneurship.
Accounting, administration, finance ops, compliance, process management.

labels.AllQuestionsNeedToBeAnswered: You must answer all questions, missing:
labels.HeroSubtitle: Complete the questionnaire and review your RIASEC areas based on your responses.
labels.MethodNote: Method: Holland's RIASEC model with items inspired by the public-domain O*NET Interest Profiler (60 items). Scoring: sum of affirmative responses per dimension, ordered.
labels.MethodSummaryScoring: Percentages are based on your “yes” answers; more affirmatives in a dimension raise its rank.
